result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R Dustin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin R Dustin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin R Dustin was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from ATIP re: BMP violation report #2;informational only; no action needed by the court

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $3,000 in this case.  Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
Final pre-trial on April 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Reporter: Lori Gerlach; State moved to dismiss ct. 1. CT granted. No prelim needed. Defn no longer eligible for Drug Diversion Program. Send to trial branch.
Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney John E Tradewell.  Don J Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Status conference on February 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at any Kohl's store
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 7

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Don J Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
